source_sentence: 大方廣入如來智德不思議經一
translation: Tathāgatagarbha's Inconceivable Wisdom and Virtue Sutra I

source_sentence: 卷
translation: roll

source_sentence: 大唐于闐三藏實叉難陀譯
translation: A Translation of the Śikṣānanda Tripiṭaka of Yutan, Great Tang

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在摩竭提國寂滅道場普光明殿，無量功德之所集起，見者靡不生大喜樂，永離一切輕毀之心。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the hall of universal light at the site of the tranquilization path in Magadha, where measureless merits are accumulated, and everyone who saw it was overjoyed and permanently freed from all despising thoughts.

source_sentence: 佛於其中坐寶蓮花師子之座，證淨等覺，所行無二，住佛所住，悉與一切諸佛平等，到無障礙不退轉法。
translation: Sitting there on a jeweled lotus lion throne, the Buddha realized pure virtual enlightenment, had no duality in what he did, abided where the buddhas abide, was equal to all of them, and attained the nonretrogression dharma without obstruction.

source_sentence: 一切所行，無能制伏，常作佛事，未曾休息，體法無相，住不思議。
translation: Nothing he does can be restrained, and he always performs Buddha-works without ever taking a break, abiding inconceivably in the form of things without marks.

source_sentence: 三世所生，了無差別，其身充遍一切世界，智達諸法，甞無迷惑。
translation: He comprehends no distinctions among the three worlds in which he's born, fills all the worlds with his body, and has never been confused in his knowledge and understanding of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 覺一切行，斷諸疑網，其身微妙，不可分別，到無二智究竟彼岸，為諸菩薩之所宗仰，住無差別如來解脫，入無中邊佛平等地，通達一切虛空法界，窮未來劫，常轉法輪。
translation: He perceives all conditioned phenomena, cuts off webs of doubt, has a subtle, indiscriminable body, reaches the ultimate shore of the wisdom of nonduality, is revered by bodhisattvas, abides in the liberation of the Tathāgata without distinction, enters the equality ground of the infinite Buddha, penetrates all space and the Dharma realm, and will always turn the Dharma wheel throughout the coming eons.

source_sentence: 與大比丘眾六十二億人俱，皆悉了達諸法實相，自性平等，猶如虛空，無所依著，永離一切煩惱蓋纏。
translation: Together with a great assembly of 6.2 billion monks, they all fully comprehend the true characteristics of all dharmas, are equal in their own nature, are like space, have no attachments, and are permanently free of all afflictive hindrances.

source_sentence: 一切如來智慧方便皆能隨入，於一法中了一切法，無分別智常現在前，常勤修習趣種智道，心無退轉，皆已成就到彼岸智，隨一切境，所行方便，無不具足。
translation: They are able to follow all the Tathāgata's wisdom and skillful means, comprehend all things in one thing, have nondiscriminating knowledge always present, and always diligently cultivate the path of aiming for various kinds of knowledge, without turning back, having accomplished knowledge of the other shore and following all objects, and the skillful means they perform are not inadequate.

source_sentence: 其名曰：舍利弗、大目揵連、摩訶迦旃延、摩訶迦葉、那提迦葉、伽耶迦葉、摩訶劫賓那、離婆多、阿[少/兔]樓馱、須菩提、富樓那彌多羅尼子、憍梵波提、周利槃陀、財力士子、佉陀羅、商主准陀、摩訶俱絺羅、難陀、羅睺羅、阿難，如是等諸大弟子而為上首。
translation: Their names are Śāriputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Mahākāśyapa, Nadī-Kāśyapa, Gayā-Kāśyapa, Mahākāśyapa, Revata, Ajñāta [less/rabbit], Subhūti, Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, Kauṇḍinya, Cūḍapanthaka, Zaḍḍīputra, Khadira, Commodore Cunda, Mahākauṣṭhila, Nandāna, Rāhula, and Ānanda, and so forth, and they're the foremost of these great disciples.

source_sentence: 復與六十億比丘尼俱，皆已久集清淨白法，近佛種智，了達方便，證一切法無性、無相安住實際，解一切法無生、無滅，無所除斷，住不思議解脫三昧，隨諸眾生應可調伏，示現種種威儀色相，而於其中無所分別。
translation: They were joined by 6 billion bhikṣus and nuns who had long collected pure white dharmas, had approached the Buddha's seed wisdom, had comprehended the method, realized that all things are without nature or characteristics, abide in reality, understand that all things are without arising or ceasing and are not subject to removal, abide in the samādhi of inconceivable liberation, follow sentient beings who can be disciplined, and display a variety of mannerisms and appearances without discriminating among them.

source_sentence: 其名曰：摩訶波闍波提及耶輸陀羅而為上首。
translation: He's called Mahāprajāpatī Yaśodharā and is the head of the group.

source_sentence: 復與十佛剎不可說百千億那由他微塵等菩薩摩訶薩俱，皆是一生補處，從餘方界來集於此，盡能普入十方世界，得涅槃道善方便智，安住菩薩觀察成就一切眾生方便法門，攝諸眾生，令斷一切戲論執取，了達諸法無邊無中，知諸眾生善惡業果皆不可得，亦不失壞。
translation: He's also with the untold ten buddha bases and untold hundreds of billions of nayutas and dust particles of bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others who have been reborn in this place and gathered here from other realms, are able to thoroughly enter the worlds of the ten directions, attain the wisdom of skillful means on the path to nirvāṇa, abide in the methodical approach of bodhisattvas observing the accomplishment of all sentient beings, and gather sentient beings in such a way that they stop all conceptual attachments, comprehend the limitlessness and insignificance of dharmas, and know that the results of good and bad actions of sentient beings are unobtainable and won't be lost.

source_sentence: 又能究其意樂煩惱諸根所行，具持三世如來所說諸法句義無有忘失，通達一切有為無為世、出世法，成就三世諸佛智輪。
translation: They can also investigate their intentions, pleasures, afflictions, and faculties, fully grasp the phrases and meanings of the teachings of the tathāgatas of the three times without forgetting them, comprehend all the worldly and supramundane dharmas that are both animate and inactive, and accomplish the wisdom wheel of the buddhas of the three times.

source_sentence: 於念念中現天宮沒、受生、出家、修行苦行、詣菩提樹、降魔成佛、轉正法輪、般涅槃相，常不厭捨一切眾生，覺悟令發大菩提心，能於一眾生心所緣境，入一切眾生心所緣境，成就自然智而受菩薩身，一切智行未曾退轉，雖常修習，而無所作。
translation: In each moment of recollection, he manifests the appearance of a heavenly palace, takes birth, leaves home, cultivates ascetic practices, reaches the bodhi tree, subdues Māra, becomes Buddha, turns the right wheel of the Dharma, and attains parinirvāṇa, never tiring of abandoning all sentient beings, awakens and causes them to give rise to the great mind of enlightenment, is able to enter the perceptual objects of the minds of one sentient being and the perceptual objects of the minds of all sentient beings, achieves natural knowledge, and attains the body of a bodhisattva, never turning back from all his wisdom practices, and does nothing despite constant practice.

source_sentence: 能無量劫為一眾生住世說法，護持法藏，紹諸佛種。
translation: He can teach for an unlimited number of eons for a single sentient being, safeguard the Dharma treasury, and introduce the seeds of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 於無佛處現佛出世如眾生數，示成正覺，得加趺坐，充遍十方，圓滿大智。
translation: In the absence of a buddha, he manifests a buddha appearing in the world like a multitude of sentient beings, becomes fully awakened, attains lotus position, fills the ten directions, and perfects great wisdom.

source_sentence: 嚴淨一切雜穢國土，滅除一切菩薩業障。
translation: He gloriously purifies all defiled lands and extinguishes all bodhisattva karmic hindrances.

source_sentence: 虛空法界，一切功德皆悉具足。
translation: All the merits of the universe and the Dharma realm are fully possessed.

source_sentence: 證法實際，無所障礙，得一切法平等智印。
translation: Realizing the reality of dharmas without any obstructions, he attains the seal of wisdom regarding the equality of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 印知諸法，自性平等，所見所聞，如影如響。
translation: With this seal, he knows that all things are equal in their own nature, and what he sees and hears are like shadows and sounds.

source_sentence: 住不思議解脫三昧自在遊戲首楞嚴定，成就出生諸佛相好陀羅尼門，具三世佛清淨行願，成就普賢殊勝意樂。
translation: He abides in the samādhi of inconceivable liberation, freely plays in the śūraṃgama concentration, accomplishes the dhāraṇī approach of producing the characteristics of the buddhas, fulfills the pure practice and vows of the buddhas of the three times, and fulfills the outstanding aspirations of Samantabhadra.

source_sentence: 諸佛出世，咸詣其所，恭敬勸請。
translation: When the buddhas of the world appear, they all go to their places and respectfully invite them.

source_sentence: 於一毛道中現一切世界，於一毛道中現於十方，始從下生，乃至最後般涅槃相，以十方一切諸佛眾會現一佛眾會；以一佛眾會，現十方一切諸佛眾會，現十方界入自身中。
translation: In a single hair of the path, he manifests all the worlds, in a single hair of the path he manifests them in ten directions, starting from birth down to the final parinirvāṇa aspect, manifests one congregation of buddhas in all ten directions, manifests one congregation of buddhas in all ten directions with one congregation of buddhas, and manifests the worlds in ten directions into himself.

source_sentence: 於自身中現一切眾生身，隨為演說無量法要。
translation: In himself, he manifests the bodies of all sentient beings and explains the essentials of measureless dharmas accordingly.

source_sentence: 現一切佛身入一佛身，以一佛身入一切佛身；於一眾生身現無量眾生身，於一切眾生身現一眾生身；於一生身現三世生身，三世生身現一生身。
translation: He shows the bodies of all buddhas into the body of one buddha, and he shows the bodies of all buddhas with the body of one buddha; he shows the body of measureless sentient beings in the body of one sentient being, and he shows the body of one sentient being in the body of all sentient beings; he shows the bodies of three worldly beings in the body of one life, and he shows the body of one life in the body of three worldly beings.

source_sentence: 現過去世入未來世，以未來世入過去世；以過去世入現在世，以現在世入過去世。
translation: He enters the future life with the present past life and the past life with the future life, enters the present life with the past life, and enters the past life with the present life.

source_sentence: 於一身中入深禪定，於無量無數身起；無量無數身入深禪定，於一身起。
translation: Entering deep meditation in one body gives rise to measureless and countless bodies, and entering deep meditation with measureless and countless bodies gives rise to one body.

source_sentence: 於一佛身現一切眾生身，一切眾生身現一佛身；於眾生身現淨法身，於淨法身現眾生身。
translation: In one Buddha's body, the bodies of all sentient beings appear, and in the bodies of all sentient beings, the body of one Buddha appears; in the bodies of sentient beings, the pure Dharma body appears, and in the pure Dharma body, the bodies of sentient beings appear.

source_sentence: 以一佛剎及莊嚴事現一切淨剎；以一切佛剎及莊嚴事現一淨剎；以十方界入一毛孔，為諸眾生顯示一切諸佛願力，普於十方隨可化度，為現無上正等菩提。
translation: With one buddha-body and its adornments, he presents all pure buddhas, and with all buddha-bodies and their adornments, he presents one pure buddha-body; with one pore in each of the ten directions, he shows all sentient beings the power of the buddhas' vows, makes them available in all ten directions, and brings about unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 於無數劫一一世界行菩薩行而無休息；於一微塵容納無邊不可稱量算數世界，令諸眾生無有迫窄。
translation: He performs the bodhisattva's actions in each world for countless eons without resting, and he includes in a tiny particle an infinite number of incalculable worlds, so that sentient beings aren't constrained.

source_sentence: 促無量不思議劫為一須臾，演一須臾為無量不思議劫。
translation: It urges measureless inconceivable eons to become a single moment, and it shows that a single moment is a measureless inconceivable eon.

source_sentence: 一剎那中，普於十方一切世界，隨諸眾生：卵生、胎生、濕生、化生；有形、無形、有色、無色；無足、二足、四足、多足；天龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、釋、梵、護世、人、非人等，應可調伏，為現種種威儀所行，而其身心無分別用。
translation: In a single moment, he follows sentient beings in all the worlds of the ten directions: egg-born, womb-born, wet-born, and transformation-born; shaped, formless, colored, and formless; legless, two-legged, four-legged, and many-legged; and gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, kaluras, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, Śākyamunis, Brahmās, world protectors, humans, and nonhumans, etc., who can be subdued and made to behave in a variety of ways, with no discriminating function of body or mind.

source_sentence: 斯諸菩薩，皆得如是善巧方便，及餘無量阿僧祇功德。
translation: Such bodhisattvas all attain such skillful means and measureless other merits.

source_sentence: 其名曰：普賢菩薩、普眼菩薩、普化菩薩、普慧菩薩、普目菩薩、普光菩薩、普明菩薩、普照菩薩、普幢菩薩、普覺菩薩、大速疾菩薩、大速疾持菩薩、大神變菩薩、大神變王菩薩、大精進菩薩、大勇健菩薩、大奮迅菩薩、大奮迅力菩薩、大眾生菩薩、大香象菩薩、大月菩薩、妙月菩薩、功德月菩薩、寶月菩薩、普月菩薩、法無垢月菩薩、毘盧遮那月菩薩、名稱月菩薩、光明月菩薩、滿月菩薩、梵音菩薩、梵主雷音菩薩、地音菩薩、法界音菩薩、破一切魔音菩薩、震法鼓音菩薩、普覺音菩薩、無分別音菩薩、地上音菩薩、蔽一切聲音菩薩、平等藏菩薩、離垢藏菩薩、功德藏菩薩、光明藏菩薩、寶藏菩薩、月藏菩薩、日藏菩薩、日生藏菩薩、蓮花藏菩薩、慧藏菩薩、大慧菩薩、勝慧菩薩、名稱慧菩薩、無上慧菩薩、增長慧菩薩、無量慧菩薩、廣慧菩薩、佛慧菩薩、無盡慧菩薩、海慧菩薩、彌樓燈菩薩、大燈菩薩、法燈菩薩、照十方燈菩薩、普燈菩薩、破一切暗燈菩薩、照一切處燈菩薩、決定照燈菩薩、月燈菩薩、日燈菩薩、文殊師利菩薩、觀世音菩薩、大勢至菩薩、金剛藏菩薩、功德藏菩薩、離惡趣菩薩、藥王菩薩、藥上菩薩、雷音菩薩、花首菩薩、日光菩薩、離垢勇猛菩薩、金剛慧菩薩、滅諸蓋菩薩、降魔菩薩、寶髻菩薩、千光菩薩、降伏大魔菩薩、難見菩薩、難伏菩薩、難量菩薩、勝智菩薩、滅惡趣菩薩、彌勒菩薩，如是等菩薩摩訶薩而為上首。
translation: 其名曰：普賢菩薩、普眼菩薩、普化菩薩、普慧菩薩、普目菩薩、普光菩薩、普明菩薩、普照菩薩、普幢菩薩、普覺菩薩、大速疾菩薩、大速疾持菩薩、大神變菩薩、大神變王菩薩、大精進菩薩、大勇健菩薩、大奮迅菩薩、大奮迅力菩薩、大眾生菩薩、大香象菩薩、大月菩薩、妙月菩薩、功德月菩薩、寶月菩薩、普月菩薩、法無垢月菩薩、毘盧遮那月菩薩、名稱月菩薩、光明月菩薩、滿月菩薩、梵音菩薩、梵主雷音菩薩、地音菩薩、法界音菩薩、破一切魔音菩薩、震法鼓音菩薩、普覺音菩薩、無分別音菩薩、地上音菩薩、蔽一切聲音菩薩、平等藏菩薩、離垢藏菩薩、功德藏菩薩、光明藏菩薩、寶藏菩薩、月藏菩薩、日藏菩薩、日生藏菩薩、蓮花藏菩薩、慧藏菩薩、大慧菩薩、勝慧菩薩、名稱慧菩薩、無上慧菩薩、增長慧菩薩、無量慧菩薩、廣慧菩薩、佛慧菩薩、無盡慧菩薩、海慧菩薩、彌樓燈菩薩、大燈菩薩、法燈菩薩、照十方燈菩薩、普燈菩薩、破一切暗燈菩薩、照一切處燈菩薩、決定照燈菩薩、月燈菩薩、日燈菩薩、文殊師利菩薩、觀世音菩薩、大勢至菩薩、金剛藏菩薩、功德藏菩薩、離惡趣菩薩、藥王菩薩、藥上菩薩、雷音菩薩、花首菩薩、日光菩薩、離垢勇猛菩薩、金剛慧菩薩、滅諸蓋菩薩、降魔菩薩、寶髻菩薩、千光菩薩、降伏大魔菩薩、難見菩薩、難伏菩薩、難量菩薩、勝智菩薩、滅惡趣菩薩、彌勒菩薩，如是等菩薩摩訶薩而為上首。

source_sentence: 復有無量不可思議、不可稱量，天龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、釋、梵、護世，皆從十方佛剎來集。
translation: There were also measureless, unfathomable, and indescribable gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, Śākyamunis, Brahmās, and world protectors who came from the buddha bases in ten directions to assemble.

source_sentence: 時此世界復有百億六欲諸天、魔王、太子、商主為首，與無量諸天眷屬，俱詣佛所，為見如來禮拜、供養、聽受法故。
translation: At the time, there were another 10 billion gods with the six desires, headed by Māra kings, crown princes, and merchant masters, along with measureless retinues of gods, who all went to the Buddha's place in order to see the Tathāgata, venerate, make offerings, and listen to the teaching.

source_sentence: 復有百億大梵天王，乃至百億色究竟天，魔醯首羅而為上首，亦與無量諸天眷屬俱詣佛所，為見如來禮拜、供養、聽受法故。
translation: There are 10 billion great brahma kings and 10 billion gods of the form realm, with Mahêśvara as their head, who also go to the Buddha with their retinues of measureless gods in order to see the Tathāgata, venerate, make offerings, and listen to the teachings.

source_sentence: 復有百億八部王眾及無量人、非人、優婆塞、優婆夷等，各與眷屬俱詣佛所，為見如來禮拜、供養、聽受法故。
translation: There are also 10 billion of the eightfold order of kings and measureless humans, nonhumans, upāsaka, and upāsikā, each of whom goes to the Buddha with his retinue in order to see the Tathāgata, venerate, make offerings, and listen to the teachings.

source_sentence: 復有一切草木叢林諸藥神等，及彌樓山、摩訶彌樓山、目真隣陀山、摩訶目真隣陀山、雪山、鐵圍山等一切山神；河海、陂池、國邑、聚落所有諸神，并八部眾諸宮殿神，亦與眷屬俱詣佛所，為見如來禮拜、供養、聽受法故。
translation: There are also the medicinal spirits of all the herbs and trees in the forest, the mountain spirits of Mount Miliṇḍa, Mount Mahāmiliṇḍa, Mount Maudgalyāyana, Mount Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Mount Snowdon, Mount Telegraph, and other mountains, the spirits of rivers and seas, unpolluted rivers and ponds, country towns and villages, and the spirits of the eight groups of palaces, who also come with their retinues to the Buddha's abode in order to see the Tathāgata, venerate, make offerings, and listen to the teachings.

source_sentence: 復有百億日月諸天，及阿那婆達多龍王，各與無量眷屬圍繞，俱詣佛所，為見如來禮拜、供養、聽受法故。
translation: Tens of billions of sun and moon gods and the dragon king Anavatapta each came to the Buddha with their countless retinues, venerating, making offerings, and listening to the teachings.

source_sentence: 是諸大眾以佛神力不相障礙，無有迫隘。
translation: These people were unobstructed by the Buddha's spiritual power and were not constrained by it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊光明顯照，蔽於眾會，猶如白月十五日滿，淨除雲翳，光明顯照，映蔽眾星，亦如須彌山王安住不動。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān's radiance shone brightly and obscured the congregation like the fifteenth full day of a white moon, which purifies and removes cloud cover and shines brightly, reflecting the stars, and like Mount Sumeru the king of mountains standing still and unmoving.

source_sentence: 如來光明普蔽一切釋梵諸天，高顯特尊亦復如是。
translation: The Tathāgata's light completely shades all the Śākyas and Brahmā gods, and so does the Venerable Kośīnī Tejorā.

source_sentence: 爾時文殊師利童子告滅諸蓋菩薩言：「如來今者安住於此，身不動搖，汝知之乎？」
translation: It was then that Mañjuśrī addressed the Bodhisattva Cessation of the Coverings, "Does the Tathāgata know that he's standing here now, his body unshaken?"

source_sentence: 彼即答言：「文殊師利！
translation: He then replied, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如來今者雖在此會安住不動，有諸天人或見出家修行苦行；或見往詣菩提樹下安處道場，降伏魔怨，成等正覺，諸天龍王、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、釋梵、護世咸共讚言：『善哉！
translation: Although the Tathāgata is now standing motionless in this assembly, some gods or humans who see him leaving home and cultivating ascetic practices or who see him going under the bodhi tree and setting up his site of enlightenment, subduing Māra and becoming perfectly enlightened, are praised by gods, dragon kings, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, kaluras, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, Śakra and Brahmā, and the world protectors, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 大師能勝怨敵！』
translation: A 'great teacher who is able to overcome enemies!'

source_sentence: 或見釋梵、護世諸天勸請說法；或見為其說布施法；或見為說持戒、忍辱、精進、禪定、智慧、方便力願智法；或見為說聲聞乘法；或見為說獨覺乘法；或見為說無上乘法；或見為說畜生、餓鬼、閻摩羅界、四天王天、三十三天，乃至梵宮受生等法。
translation: Sometimes they see Śakra and the gods who protect the world urging them to preach; sometimes they see them teaching the Dharma of generosity; sometimes they see them teaching the Dharma of observing precepts, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom, and the knowledge of the vows of skillful means; sometimes they see them teaching the Dharma of the śrāvaka vehicle; sometimes they see them teaching the Dharma of the pratyekabuddha vehicle; sometimes they see them teaching the Dharma of the unsurpassed vehicle; sometimes they see them teaching the Dharma of animals, hungry ghosts, the Yamaṇa realm, the four heavenly kings, the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, and even the birth in the Brahma palace.

source_sentence: 或見為說生人趣法；或見為說生轉輪王法。
translation: Some views teach the way to be born in a human rebirth, and some views teach the way to be born as a wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 「又，文殊師利！
translation: "And, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 於此眾中，或見如來身高一尋；或一俱盧、或二俱盧；或半由旬、或一由旬、或二由旬、或十由旬、或百或千或萬由旬；或見五萬、十萬、百萬或五百萬，乃至或見超過一切數量由旬。
translation: Among them, some see the Tathāgata's body standing a fathom tall, or one or two crowns, or half a yojana, or one yojana, or two yojana, or ten yojana, or a hundred or thousand or ten thousand yojana, or fifty thousand, one hundred thousand, one million, or five million, or more than all the yojana in existence.

source_sentence: 「或見佛身作真金色、或琉璃色、或帝青摩尼色、或大青摩尼色、或光明摩尼色、或紅蓮花摩尼色、或釋迦毘楞伽摩尼色、或金剛光明摩尼色、或天光摩尼色、或日月光摩尼色、或水精摩尼色、或頗梨摩尼色、或自在王摩尼色、或集眾光摩尼色、或師子鬘摩尼色、或師子幢摩尼色、或海住淨光摩尼色、或如意摩尼色，隨諸眾生應見如來是眾色相而調伏者，所見各殊；隨聞如來為說何法而成熟者，所聞各異；隨依何教而修行者，各如說行皆得成就。
translation: 「或見佛身作真金色、或琉璃色、或帝青摩尼色、或大青摩尼色、或光明摩尼色、或紅蓮花摩尼色、或釋迦毘楞伽摩尼色、或金剛光明摩尼色、或天光摩尼色、或日月光摩尼色、或水精摩尼色、或頗梨摩尼色、或自在王摩尼色、或集眾光摩尼色、或師子鬘摩尼色、或師子幢摩尼色、或海住淨光摩尼色、或如意摩尼色，隨諸眾生應見如來是眾色相而調伏者，所見各殊；隨聞如來為說何法而成熟者，所聞各異；隨依何教而修行者，各如說行皆得成就。

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 設於十方無量不可思議、不可稱量世界，滿中天龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、釋梵、護世、人、非人等，猶如竹林、甘蔗、胡麻。
translation: Suppose there were an unfathomable, immeasurable world in ten directions, filled with gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, Śakra and Brahmā, world protectors, humans, non-humans, and so forth, just like a bamboo grove, sugarcane, or sesame.

source_sentence: 若諸眾生應見如來而調伏者，見佛色相各各不同，面向其前，一尋而住，為其說法，如說修行，皆得成就。
translation: If sentient beings should see the Tathāgata and be disciplined, they'd see the Buddha's various forms and appearances, face him, look him over, stay in one place, preach for him, and practice as he's taught, and they'd all attain success.

source_sentence: 如來雖作如是眾事，自然應現而無分別。
translation: Although the Tathāgata does such a variety of things, they naturally appear without discrimination.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如滿月輪夜半之時，閻浮提中一切眾生各見月輪在其前現，是月未曾作念分別：『令諸眾生各覩我現。』
translation: At midnight, when the full moon is in full swing, all sentient beings in Jambudvīpa see the moon appearing before them, even though the moon has never thought and discerned, 'Let's let all sentient beings see me now.'

source_sentence: 法爾而有如是事起。
translation: Thus, this kind of thing arises.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，雖復普現諸眾生前，亦不分別：『令諸眾生皆得見我現前而住。』
translation: So too, even though the Tathāgata universally appears to all sentient beings, he doesn't discriminate, 'Let all sentient beings see me presently and abide.'

source_sentence: 但隨眾生可調伏者，各自見佛現在其前。
translation: Only those sentient beings who can be disciplined will each see the Buddha presently in front of them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 隨應眾生不共法故。
translation: That's because they're appropriate for sentient beings who don't share the same dharma.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如一切眾生由上中下業果力故，所作諸行亦有三品。
translation: "Just as all sentient beings have three classes of actions that they perform as a result of the effects of higher, middle, and lower actions, so do they have three classes of actions.

source_sentence: 而是諸行，終不自生三種分別，但由業故，自然有是上中下品諸行事起。
translation: Rather, their actions never give rise to the three kinds of discrimination on their own, but naturally, because of their actions, these actions of higher, middle, and lower classes arise.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，由諸眾生業果力故，各自見佛；如來亦無上中下念，自然應現如是等事。
translation: So it is with the Tathāgata, for it's the result of the actions of sentient beings that they each see the Buddha, and the Tathāgata has no thoughts of higher, middle, or lower, and naturally produces these kinds of things.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如淨頗梨置諸衣上作種種色：若在黃衣，便作黃色；在青赤衣，作青赤色。
translation: "Suppose a pure heap of pearls places various colors on robes: if it's placed on a yellow robe, it'll be yellow; if it's placed on a blue-red robe, it'll be blue-red.

source_sentence: 隨其所置，雖作彼色，是淨頗梨終無分別。
translation: Whatever color they put on it, although it's made in that color, the pure pāri never discriminates it.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，由眾生感作種種色。
translation: Similarly, the Tathāgata creates various forms based on the sensations of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若諸眾生應見金色而調伏者，便見金色；若有應見琉璃、真珠、帝青、大青、集眾光摩尼、海住淨光摩尼、師子鬘摩尼、師子幢摩尼、電燈摩尼、水精摩尼，是諸寶色而調伏者，便見如來作如是等眾寶色相。
translation: If sentient beings should see gold and be disciplined, then they'll see gold; if they should see lapis lazuli, real pearl, diaphanous blue, great blue, a maṇi of light that gathers multitudes, a maṇi of pure light that abides in the ocean, a maṇi of lion's garland, a maṇi of lion's banner, a maṇi of electric lamp, a maṇi of water essence, or any of these precious colors and be disciplined, then they'll see the Tathāgata create such a variety of precious colors.

source_sentence: 或有應以釋梵、護世而調伏者，便見釋梵、護世色相。
translation: Perhaps someone should subdue them with the form of Śakra and Brahmā or Śubhavyūha, and then they'll see the form of Śakra and Brahmā and Śubhavyūha.

source_sentence: 如是乃至應以地獄、餓鬼、畜生、閻羅王處、色無色界；卵生、胎生、濕生、化生；有色、無色、有想、無想、非有想、非無想；隨何趣生、威儀色相而調伏者，則見如來作如是等種種色相。
translation: From there, they'll see the Tathāgata create such a variety of form appearances when they should be disciplined by hell, hungry ghosts, animals, the king of jams, the form and formless realms, egg birth, birth in the womb, wet birth, and birth by transformation, birth with or without form, birth with or without perception, birth without perception, birth not with or without perception, and birth according to any destiny and form of deportment.

source_sentence: 然佛未曾分別念言：『令此眾生，惟見金色莫見琉璃；惟見琉璃莫見帝青；如是乃至惟見師子鬘摩尼，莫見師子幢摩尼色。』
translation: However, the Buddha has never discriminated and said, 'Let these sentient beings see only gold and not lapis lazuli, see only lapis lazuli and not diaphanous blue, and so forth, see only the maṇi of the lion's garland and not the maṇi of the lion's banner.'

source_sentence: 雖無如是異念分別，隨一切處，自然有是諸色相現。
translation: Although there's no such discrimination of different thoughts, these forms naturally appear in all places.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如出生自在摩尼王處不生諸鐵，是摩尼王終不念言：『令彼寶處但生於我，莫生於鐵。』
translation: "It's like the place where iron doesn't grow in the Maṇi King who has the sovereign power to give birth, and the Maṇi King never thinks, 'Let that precious place only grow in me and not in iron.'

source_sentence: 然其寶處，鐵自不生。
translation: Still, iron doesn't arise in those precious places.

source_sentence: 如來所生剎土亦爾，自無一切外道異論、諸惡賊亂、五無間罪、十不善業、非法王教，亦無一切日月諸天及摩尼寶火電等光，及以須臾日月歲數，除佛變現化諸眾生，雖有所現而無分別。
translation: Similarly, the bodhisattva's birthplace is naturally free of all non-Buddhist non-Buddhist beliefs, evil and traitorous behavior, the five heinous crimes, the ten unwholesome activities, and the non-Buddhist teachings of the king, as well as all the sun and moon gods, the fire and lightning of the maṇi-jewel, and the number of years in the sun and moon, except for the transformation of sentient beings by the Buddha's manifestation, which has no discrimination despite its appearances.

source_sentence: 由眾生故，自然有是種種事起。
translation: It's because of sentient beings that these various things naturally arise.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如大青摩尼寶光，觸者皆作大青寶色，而寶終無異念分別；如來亦爾。
translation: "It's like the great blue maṇi-jewel light, which always turns into the color of a great blue gem when it's touched, but the gem never has different thoughts about it; so it is with the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 觸佛作意所緣光者，靡不皆成一切智色，然佛亦無異念分別，自然而有如是事起。
translation: Whenever you touch the light that's the object of a Buddha's attention, it always turns into the color of omniscience, but the Buddha doesn't discriminate it differently and it naturally gives rise to such things.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如善磨瑩大琉璃寶，隨於其邊安置種種手、足、頭、頸眾莊嚴具，以寶威力，彼莊嚴具，莫不明顯。
translation: "Suppose the great emerald gem Sunetra places various adornments of hand, foot, head, and neck at its side, and by the power of that gem, none of those adornments are visible.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，隨其所行威儀住處有修行者，以佛威力，令其所行皆自增勝。
translation: The Tathāgata likewise follows the mannerisms of his practice and abodes of practice, and because of the Buddha's authority, he causes them to become superior in their own ways.

source_sentence: 然佛未曾動念分別，自然而有如是事起。
translation: Still, the Buddha hasn't moved his mind to discriminate, and such things arise naturally.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如眾卉木依地而住各得增長，然地了無種種分別。
translation: "Just as many plants and trees grow based on their standing in the ground, the ground is completely undiscriminated.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，令諸眾生一切善根依如來住各得增長，而實曾無異念分別，自然而有如是事起。
translation: The Tathāgata likewise causes sentient beings to grow in all their good roots depending on the Tathāgata's abode, but there really has never been any discrimination of different thoughts that naturally gives rise to such things.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如大雲普覆一切草木叢林，等澍甘雨，隨一味水所及之處，令諸草木皆得增長，種種色味差別不同，彼雲未曾有所分別，自然有是種種相異。
translation: It's like a great cloud that covers all the grass and trees and forests with equal sweet rain, and wherever a single taste of water reaches, it causes the grass and trees to grow, with various differences in color and taste that have never been discerned by that cloud and naturally have these various characteristics.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，興正覺雲遍覆一切，隨諸眾生先所積集種種善根、種種願樂、種種信解、種種解脫，等澍法雨，令諸眾生一切善根，隨其勢力各得增長，如來亦不分別念言：『我當令是眾生善根生聲聞智；我當令是眾生善根生獨覺智；我當令是眾生善根生如來智；我當令是眾生善根生四天王天、三十三天，如是乃至淨居等天；我當令是眾生善根，得作國王，及與人中種種生處。』
translation: Similarly, the Tathāgata produces a cloud of right awakening that pervades all sentient beings, and according to their prior accumulation of various good roots, various vows, various convictions, and various liberations, it rains down the Dharma in equal measure, causing all the good roots of sentient beings to grow according to their momentum.

source_sentence: 然佛雖無種種分別，隨諸眾生所集善根願樂等力，自然有是種種事起，由佛已捨一切處著無分別故。
translation: Although the Buddha doesn't discriminate in various ways, these various things naturally arise according to the power of the good roots, vows, and other desires that sentient beings gather, because the Buddha has abandoned all attachments to various places without discrimination.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如日纔現，放無量億百千光明破閻浮提一切黑暗，是日雖復不分別言：『我當破暗。』
translation: Like a sun that rises up and shines with measureless millions of hundred thousand rays of light to dispel all the darkness in Jambudvīpa, even though that sun doesn't discriminate, saying, 'I will dispel the darkness.'

source_sentence: 自然而有破暗事生。
translation: Naturally, something will arise that destroys the darkness.

source_sentence: 如來日輪亦復如是，出世間已，放無量億智慧光明，滅除世間諸見黑暗，除佛威力示現成熟諸眾生者，如來雖不分別念言：『令眾生見，現破當破。』
translation: So it is with the Tathāgata's sun-wheel, which, after emerging from the world, radiates measureless millions of rays of wisdom that extinguish the darkness of worldly views and mature sentient beings except for the Buddha's authoritative manifestation, even though the Tathāgata doesn't discriminate and says, 'Let sentient beings see that this present destruction will be destroyed.'

source_sentence: 於一切處，自然有此種種事起，由佛已捨一切處著無分別故。
translation: These various things naturally arise in all places because the Buddha has abandoned attachment and nondiscrimination in all places.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如幻師幻作眾像，雖有種種形類不同，幻無分別，不可稱說；無起無盡、無字無聲、無有方所、無體無相，不可思議；無二無行、無等無對，但由幻師現是眾相。
translation: "It's like an illusionist who conjures up images that, although they have various forms and differences, are illusory, indescribable, have no discrimination, have no beginning or end, have no words or sounds, have no location, have no body or characteristics, and are inconceivable; they have no duality, no practice, and no equality or opposition, but are simply the result of the illusionist's manifestation of these various forms.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，由眾生故，入於種種威儀行處，一切皆見。
translation: So it is with the Tathāgata, who, because of sentient beings, enters into various places of deportment and conduct where everything is seen.

source_sentence: 然實如來不可稱說、無起無盡、無字無聲、無有方所、無性無相、無二無行，等真法界非可觸對。
translation: Yet the Tathāgata is ineffable, unarisen, inexhaustible, wordless, without sound, without place or location, without nature or characteristics, without duality or form, and equally true in the Dharma realm, which is not opposable to contact.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如日映須彌山故，四洲眾生或見初出、或見日中、或見漸暮、或見初沒、或見夜半、或見漸曙；但一日輪，隨四天下諸眾生見各各不同。
translation: "It's like when the sun reflects off Mount Sumeru, so sentient beings on the four continents sometimes see the first rising, the middle of the day, the approaching dusk, the first disappearance, the middle of the night, or the approaching dawn; but with one day of the wheel, the views of sentient beings under the four heavens are different from each other.

source_sentence: 日無分別，但由山蔽，自然四洲所見各異。
translation: There's no discrimination between the sun and the hills, but naturally the four continents are shaded by different views.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，於一眾會，或見如來將成正覺、已成正覺；將入涅槃、已入涅槃；或見成佛已經十年，乃至已經不可說劫；或見涅槃已經十年，乃至已經百千億劫；或見如來一十、二十，或四十年在世說法；或見法住，或見法滅。
translation: Similarly, in a congregation, the Tathāgata might see that the Tathāgata is about to become perfectly enlightened or has become perfectly enlightened, is about to enter nirvāṇa or has entered nirvāṇa, has been a buddha for ten years or even an untold eon, has been in nirvāṇa for ten years or even a hundred billion eons, has taught for ten, twenty, or forty years, has seen the teaching of the Dharma abide, or has seen the cessation of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 然佛曾無異念分別，由眾生故，自然有是種種事起。
translation: Still, the Buddha has never had a different discernment, and these kinds of things naturally arise because of the sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如大風吹閻浮提，一切草木枝葉紛亂，東西南北或靡或起，草木終無種種分別，但由風故，種種相生。
translation: It's like when a great wind blows through Jambudvīpa, and all the grass and trees are tangled up with branches and leaves, sometimes falling apart or rising from east to west or from north to south, but the grass and trees are never discriminated in any way, except that various things arise as a result of the wind.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，常無分別，由眾生力，於念念中，見有如是無量眾行威儀相起，乃至作意，緣諸眾生，令爾所劫，得斷地獄、畜生、餓鬼、閻羅等趣。
translation: The Tathāgata, too, always has no discrimination, and because of the power of sentient beings, he sees in each recitation the appearance of measureless multitudes of actions and mannerisms that arise, even as he contemplates and takes sentient beings as cause, so that for those eons he'll be able to end the destinies of hell, animals, hungry ghosts, and jambu trees.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如來成就如是無量微妙功德。」
translation: The Tathāgata has accomplished such measureless and subtle merits."

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如來作意一念所緣，諸大菩薩，無量百千那由他劫，住不思議解脫三昧，不能知其功德邊際。
translation: Such is the object of a single thought of the Tathāgata's attention that great bodhisattvas who have abided in the samādhi of inconceivable liberation for measureless hundreds of thousands of nayutas couldn't know the limits of its merit.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如日輪從大海出，住虛空中，放無量億那由他光，遍照一切城邑聚落，破大黑暗，銷涸洿池，增長一切草木叢林悉令成熟，發起一切所作事業，光影普入諸河池中，而常未曾離於本事。
translation: It's like a sun wheel emerging from the ocean and standing in space, radiating measureless millions of nayutas of light that shines everywhere, destroying great darkness and drying up stagnant pools, growing all the grass and trees and forests to maturity, initiating all the works that it does, and its light and shadow entering all the rivers and pools without ever leaving its capacity.

source_sentence: 是日雖無種種分別，自然而有是等事現。
translation: Although these suns lack all kinds of discrimination, these things naturally occur.

source_sentence: 如來亦爾，出諸有海，住法虛空，放無量億智慧光明，遍照十方一切世界，滅諸眾生無明翳膜，枯竭一切煩惱濁流，令諸眾生善根福慧增長成熟。
translation: The Tathāgata also emerges from the ocean of existence and abides in space, radiating measureless millions of rays of wisdom that illuminate all the worlds in the ten directions, extinguishing the film of ignorance in sentient beings, drying up all the turbid currents of affliction, and causing sentient beings to grow in good roots and ripen in merit and wisdom.

source_sentence: 雖同一時現是眾事，亦常湛然本處不動，由佛已離念想分別，自然應現是諸相故。
translation: Even though these things are manifested at the same time, they are always motionless in their original place because the Buddha has parted with mindfulness and discrimination and naturally responds by showing these forms.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，於恒河沙劫，以天上味及天妙衣，施十方界微塵等一切諸佛及聲聞眾。
translation: "Suppose there are good sons and good women who, during an eon as vast as the sands of the Ganges, give the taste of heaven and the marvelous clothing of gods to all the buddhas and śrāvakas of the ten directions in a dusty world.

source_sentence: 彼佛滅後，為一一佛遍滿十方一一世界，造十方界微塵等塔，其塔皆是閻浮檀金，電光摩尼互相間錯。
translation: After that Buddha's death, he or she would build dusty stūpas of gold and gold jambu, with electric lights and manis interspersed throughout each world in the ten directions for each of those buddhas.

source_sentence: 集眾光寶，周圍欄楯，寶幢遐建，寶鈴流響，蛇衛栴檀以為塗香，覆以自在摩尼王網，其上復有天寶蓋雲、寶幡幢雲、妙花香雲、摩尼王雲、如意珠雲，徘徊散空滿三千界，日日三時，如是供養，經恒沙劫，兼復教化無數眾生。
translation: Gathering a multitude of luminous treasures, surrounded by railing and shields, with jeweled banners erected far and wide, with jeweled bells ringing, perfumed by snake-guard sandalwood, and covered with a self-contained maṇi-net, they are further surmounted by clouds of heavenly jeweled canopies, clouds of jeweled banners and banners, clouds of the fragrance of wonderful flowers, clouds of maṇi-rulers, and clouds of wish-granting beads that wander through space and fill 3,000 realms, making offerings like this day after day and three times a day for eons of eternity and teaching countless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 如是供養，不如有人聞此入如來智德不思議境界法門，心生信解，其福過彼無量阿僧祇。
translation: Such an offering wouldn't be as good as someone who hears this teaching of entering the Tathāgata's inconceivable state of wisdom and virtue and becomes convinced of it, which would bring blessings beyond those countless incalculably long eons.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若有菩薩信解此法，則速成滿菩薩摩訶薩無量億那由他諸波羅蜜，證入無量億那由他地，背捨無量億那由他生死，了知無量億那由他諸佛神通，破無量阿僧祇我慢山，倒無量阿僧祇慳嫉幢，竭無量阿僧祇愛河，渡無量阿僧祇生死海，斷無量阿僧祇魔網，掩蔽一切日月釋梵護世威光。
translation: If a bodhisattva believes and understands this teaching, then he quickly fulfills measureless nayutas of the perfection of bodhisattvas, realizes measureless nayutas of ground, turns his back on measureless nayutas of birth and death, comprehends measureless nayutas of the Buddha's supernormal powers, breaks through measureless incalculable mountains of self-conceit, tilts measureless incalculable banners of stinginess and jealousy, dries up measureless incalculable rivers of love, wades through measureless incalculable oceans of birth and death, cuts measureless incalculable webs of Māra, and obscures all the suns, moons, Śākyamunis, and Brahmās that protect the world with their authoritative light.

source_sentence: 從一佛剎至一佛剎，能救地獄、餓鬼、畜生、閻羅王界諸苦眾生，常得親近諸佛菩薩，具足成就海印三昧、持一切法三昧、法自在三昧、諸相莊嚴三昧、寶生三昧、安樂三昧、蓮花莊嚴三昧、虛空藏三昧、隨入世間三昧、妙法花三昧、境界自在三昧、大奮迅三昧、虛空心三昧、師子奮迅三昧、日燈三昧、無量旋三昧、澍甘露三昧、金剛幢三昧、如金剛三昧、金剛齊三昧、地持三昧、須彌燈三昧、須彌幢三昧、寶藏三昧、心自在三昧、一切眾生心自在三昧、增長一切行三昧、深密方便三昧、種種辯才三昧、無能見三昧、了諸法三昧、遊戲三昧、出生一切神通三昧、降魔三昧、現一切色相三昧、一切色最勝三昧、觀身三昧、具一切行三昧、智燈三昧、菩提光三昧、樂說辯才三昧、入一切功德三昧、說諸法實相三昧、寂靜神通三昧、首楞嚴三昧、海潮三昧；又得無量佛身相陀羅尼、大智陀羅尼、淨音陀羅尼、無盡篋陀羅尼、無量旋陀羅尼、海印陀羅尼、入決定辯才陀羅尼、諸佛住持陀羅尼；又得隨順一切眾生殊勝行，一切法無師智，斷一切法疑；得佛神通，具菩薩行善巧方便。
translation: 從一佛剎至一佛剎，能救地獄、餓鬼、畜生、閻羅王界諸苦眾生，常得親近諸佛菩薩，具足成就海印三昧、持一切法三昧、法自在三昧、諸相莊嚴三昧、寶生三昧、安樂三昧、蓮花莊嚴三昧、虛空藏三昧、隨入世間三昧、妙法花三昧、境界自在三昧、大奮迅三昧、虛空心三昧、師子奮迅三昧、日燈三昧、無量旋三昧、澍甘露三昧、金剛幢三昧、如金剛三昧、金剛齊三昧、地持三昧、須彌燈三昧、須彌幢三昧、寶藏三昧、心自在三昧、一切眾生心自在三昧、增長一切行三昧、深密方便三昧、種種辯才三昧、無能見三昧、了諸法三昧、遊戲三昧、出生一切神通三昧、降魔三昧、現一切色相三昧、一切色最勝三昧、觀身三昧、具一切行三昧、智燈三昧、菩提光三昧、樂說辯才三昧、入一切功德三昧、說諸法實相三昧、寂靜神通三昧、首楞嚴三昧、海潮三昧；又得無量佛身相陀羅尼、大智陀羅尼、淨音陀羅尼、無盡篋陀羅尼、無量旋陀羅尼、海印陀羅尼、入決定辯才陀羅尼、諸佛住持陀羅尼；又得隨順一切眾生殊勝行，一切法無師智，斷一切法疑；得佛神通，具菩薩行善巧方便。

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如須彌山王，高顯秀麗，映蔽餘山；菩薩信解此法門者，功德嚴淨，蔽諸眾生一切善根，亦復如是。」
translation: It's like Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, which is so lofty and beautiful that it reflects the beauty of other mountains, and so it is when a bodhisattva believes and understands this teaching and its virtues are so pure that it shields all the good roots of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 爾時文殊師利告滅諸蓋菩薩言：「佛子！
translation: It was then that Mañjuśrī addressed the Bodhisattva Cessation of Superciliousness, saying, "Son of the Buddha!

source_sentence: 復更有餘勝法。
translation: There are also other surpassing qualities.

source_sentence: 若諸菩薩能信解者，便得成就餘勝功德。」
translation: If bodhisattvas can believe and understand them, then they'll attain the other excellent qualities."

source_sentence: 滅諸蓋菩薩聞是說已，復白文殊師利言：「若有菩薩信解五法，則能除此勝法，得餘無量殊勝功德。
translation: After hearing this, the Bodhisattva Cessation of Hindrances again said to Mañjuśrī, "If bodhisattvas believe and understand five things, then they'll be able to remove this excellent teaching and attain measureless superior qualities.

source_sentence: 何等為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者，信解一切諸法，不生不滅，不可稱說，無比無對。
translation: First, they believe and understand that all dharmas neither arise nor cease, are inexpressible, and have no comparison or opposition.

source_sentence: 二者，信解如來無功用、無分別，入過閻浮提微塵等威儀行處，剎那剎那常起不絕。
translation: Second, he has faith that the Tathāgata has no function, no discrimination, and enters into places of deportment and conduct that transcend the subtleties of Jambudvīpa, where moment by moment they are constantly arising and not cut off.

source_sentence: 三者，信解釋迦如來往昔教化蘇陀婆王，但為成熟諸眾生故，然實已於恒河沙劫久成正覺。
translation: Third, faith explains that the Tathāgata taught King Sudhāra in the past only to ripen sentient beings, but he had actually achieved perfect enlightenment long before the eons of Gṛdhrakūṭa.

source_sentence: 四者，信解釋迦如來示然燈佛授記已來，乃至成佛，於是中間修菩薩行，而實已於無量劫來成等正覺，住佛境界。
translation: 4. Faith explains that after the Tathāgata showed Randana Buddha the way to record his birth, he cultivated the bodhisattva practice in the interim, but he had really become perfectly enlightened and abided in the Buddhahood for an immeasurable number of eons.

source_sentence: 五者，信解釋迦如來現託王宮，釋種被害，但為成熟諸眾生故，而實已於無量劫來成等正覺。
translation: Fifth, he believed that the Tathāgata explaining the Tathāgata's present entrustment to the palace of the king, who had been harmed by the Śākyamuni lineage but did so for the sake of ripening sentient beings, had actually achieved perfect enlightenment over measureless eons.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 菩薩若能於此五種生信解者，則能除此勝法，更得成就餘勝功德。
translation: If a bodhisattva can give rise to faith and understanding in these five ways, then he'll be able to achieve other excellent qualities in addition to this excellent teaching.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，於恒河沙劫，日日以天百味飲食及天妙衣，施十方界微塵等諸阿羅漢，具六神通、八解脫者，所得功德，不如有人於一日中，但以飲食施一獨覺，其福勝彼阿僧祇倍。
translation: If good sons and good women were to give a hundred flavors of heavenly food and drink and marvelous heavenly clothing day by day to arhats of the ten directions who possess the six supernormal powers and the eight liberations, they wouldn't attain as much merit as someone who simply gives food and drink to a solitary realizer in a single day, which would be worth an incalculable amount more than that.

source_sentence: 「又，文殊師利！
translation: "And, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人，遍十方界為阿僧祇辟支佛等，造十方界微塵等精舍，一一皆以閻浮檀金所成，摩尼為柱，階陛欄楯，樓閣戶牖，咸以眾寶種種莊嚴，施大寶帳，塗妙栴檀；日日以天百味飲食及天妙衣恭敬供養，於恒沙劫，不如有人或聞佛名、或世尊名、或如來名、或一切智名，所得功德復過於彼阿僧祇倍。
translation: If good sons and good women were to pervade the worlds of the ten directions and build dusty abodes for incalculable solitary buddhas and so forth, each one made of gold, made of jambu, with columns made of maṇi, steps and rails, and windows and doors of mansions, each adorned with a variety of treasures, decorated with a great jeweled canopy, and coated with marvelous sandalwood, and offer daily respect and offerings with a hundred flavors of food and drink from the gods and fine clothing from the gods, it wouldn't be like someone who hears the name of the Buddha, the name of the Bhagavān, the name of the Tathāgata, or the name of omniscience, which would obtain more merit than incalculably more than that.

source_sentence: 況以彩畫、或以泥塐作如來像，觀見之者，福又過彼阿僧祇倍。
translation: What's more, someone who paints or makes a clay image of the Tathāgata and sees it will be blessed more than incalculably more than that.

source_sentence: 況以燈油、香花、伎樂種種供養，福又過彼阿僧祇倍。
translation: What's more, when they make offerings of oil from lamps, flowers, and music, their merit is greater than incalculably greater than that.

source_sentence: 何況有能於佛法中，下至一日護持一戒，福轉過彼阿僧祇倍。
translation: How much more so if someone can uphold the precepts in the Buddha's teaching down to the level of a single day, their merit will exceed that incalculably.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人，於恒河沙劫，日日以天百味飲食及天妙衣，供十方界微塵等諸佛菩薩及聲聞眾。
translation: "Suppose there are good sons and good women who, day by day during an eon of everlasting sands, offer up a hundred flavors of food and drink from the gods and marvelous clothing from the gods to a collection of buddhas, bodhisattvas, and śrāvakas in the dusty realms of the ten directions.

source_sentence: 諸佛滅後，一一皆起十方界微塵等塔，一一塔量遍四天下，形製奇妙，眾寶莊嚴；幡蓋、伎樂，諸供養具，逾勝於前，雖諸功德皆悉具足，未能信解此法門者，不如有人能信解是入如來智德不思議境界法門，乃至以一摶食施於畜生，其福過彼阿僧祇倍。
translation: After the buddhas' deaths, each one would erect a pagoda of the finest dust of the ten directions, each one measured across the four heavens, marvelously proportioned, adorned with many treasures, with banners, flags, music, and other offerings that surpass the previous ones, and even though all of these attributes are complete, someone who doesn't believe and understand this teaching wouldn't be as good as someone who believes and understands this teaching of entering the inconceivable realm of the Tathāgata's wisdom and virtue, even to the point of giving a handful of food to an animal, which would be more beneficial than incalculably more than that.

source_sentence: 「文殊師利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若有菩薩信解此經，如其所說供養諸佛，有餘菩薩聞已歡喜，生淨信心，從坐而起，合掌作禮，隨其所堪，修行供養，福又過彼阿僧祇倍，是人不久得佛智故。」
translation: If there are bodhisattvas who believe and understand this sūtra and make offerings to the buddhas as they've been taught, and there are other bodhisattvas who hear it, rejoice, give rise to pure faith, rise from their seats, put their palms together in prostration, and make offerings as they are able, that person will be blessed beyond incalculable proportions and will soon attain Buddha's wisdom."

source_sentence: 說是經時，彼諸比丘及菩薩眾，一切世間天、人、阿修羅等，歡喜信受，作禮奉行。
translation: When this sūtra was spoken, those monks and bodhisattva congregations, gods, humans, asuras, and others of the world rejoiced and believed it, paid homage, and handed it down.

source_sentence: 大方廣入如來智德不思議經
translation: Tathāgata's Inconceivable Wisdom and Virtue of the Great and Vast Entry
